result.execSummary:
The defendant Montrel Romel Robinson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possession of Methamphetamine, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 961.41(3g)(g).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed
supervisions.notes: With credit for 2 DAYS served, 10 DAYS straight time and remainder with Huber release for work, treatment and/or job search.

miscConds.notes:
- DNA sample and surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all mandatory fees of supervision.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.

- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.

- Comply with all rules of probation and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the Court.
- Cooperate with agent.

- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Montrel Romel Robinson

records.addlTxt: /filed.
/received and filed.  Jury Instructions.
/received and filed.  Plea Questionnaire / Waiver of Rights and Addendum

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court.  Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg in court for Montrel Romel Robinson.  Attorney Patrick T. Franken in court for State of Wisconsin. 

Case in Court for Final Pre-trial.  Parties have reached an agreement. State places offer on the record. Defense and defendant are in agreement.  Based upon the plea documents submitted, the Court VACATES the Jury Trial set for 9/6/2022.

AS TO COUNT 1 : Defendant changes plea(s) to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to plea, advised of Constitutional Rights and the maximum penalties. Defendant further advised that if not a US citizen, deportation is possible. Court found that the defendant knowingly, voluntarily and intelligently waived rights.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights form, Addendum, and Elements/Jury Instructions received and filed. Parties stipulate to the Criminal Complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea(s).  Court found defendant GUILTY and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record.  

*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, body armor, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.

Case proceeded to Sentencing. State has complied with victim notification. Statements by parties and defendant.  State makes oral amendment to the Information as to Possession of Methamphetamine and not analog Methamphetamine.  No objection by the Defense. Court approves the oral amendment.

AS TO COUNT 1 :  The court sentenced the defendant to serve 75 DAYS in the House of Correction, with credit for 2 DAYS served, 10 DAYS straight time and remainder with Huber release for work, treatment and/or job search.  The court STAYED the sentence and placed the defendant on 12 MONTHS of probation.  

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
- Absolute sobriety.
- AODA assessment, comply with recommended treatment.
- No possession, use, sale, or distribution of any illegal drugs; no association with any location where illegal substances are consumed, packaged or sold.
- Undergo random urine screens (no right to refuse screens, refusal will be treated as a positive test result) and HOC time could result from a positive test.
- Agent to notify Court upon second positive test for drugs or alcohol.
- DNA sample and surcharge (unless previously done).
- Pay all mandatory fees of supervision.
- No possession of any firearms or ammunition.
- Maintain or seek verifiable full time employment or education or vocational training.
- Comply with all rules of probation and any other conditions deemed appropriate by your agent or the Court.
- Cooperate with agent.
- No operation of a motor vehicle without valid driver's license.
- Restitution set at $0.00.
- Court waives all non-mandatory costs due to inability to pay.
- All mandatory court costs, fees, and assessments to be paid during the period of probation. If revoked, to be paid out of defendant's prison funds at an amount to be determined by the DOC and as a condition of extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

*Court advised defendant of right to seek post conviction relief.
*Court advised due to felony conviction the defendant is prohibited from firearm possession, ammunition, and defendant's voting rights are suspended and may not vote until civil rights are restored.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 8/30/22, file.d

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  John J Rejowski appeared for Patrick Franken for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a pre-trial conference. Defense requested final pre-trial and jury trial dates. Court set the following filing deadlines with parties. State has until August 1st, 2022, to submit any crime lab reports to the defense. Defense has until August 17th, 2022, to submit any change of plea forms. Parties have until August 24th, 2022, to submit any trial documents. Case adjourned to Branch 17.
Pursuant to Chief Judge Directive 22-04, parties are hereby notified that effective 7/30/22, this case is assigned to branch 9, Judge Paul Van Grunsven in room 632 of the Courthouse.  Final pre-trial scheduled for August 31, 2022 at 09:30 am.  Jury trial scheduled for September 6, 2022 at 09:00 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 5-31-2022

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Patrick T. Franken appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for a schedling conference. Court set the following filing deadlines with the parties. State is to send any and all discovery except for the crime lab reports to the defense by May 13th, 2022. Defense has until May 27th, 2022, to file any motions or change of plea paperwork. Case adjourned to Branch 17.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 1, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-27-2022

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with Attorney Arial Jade Rosenberg.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO.
Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State:  MPD Officer D. Klein.  State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 17.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 28, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Pretrial Services Supervision Report 4-5-2022, Filed.
Received and Filed. Public Defender Order Appointing Counsel

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court in person.  Matthew Zisi appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a preliminary hearing. SPD has not appointed counsel. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for April 5, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Received and Filed. Pretrial Services Supervision Report 3-2-2022

No use or possession of controlled substances without a valid prescription.
No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in court with attorney Stephen Andrew Sargent.  Defendant Montrel Romel Robinson in custody.  Edward OBrien appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Montrel Romel Robinson appeared by video means with Attorney.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Stark, Branch 17.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 3, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
